intro: Blepharis affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf eveningflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its unique flowering pattern and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ecological research.
